column4: I'm running a Ruby_GNOME2 tutorial app that will not "quit".  How do I kill a program process via command line?
you could try 'ps aux | grep Ruby*' and find its process #  then do what IcemanV9 said
type 'top' in terminal and find that .rb file's pid # then kill it's pid #
might be easier to use htop (its nicer than top) but you have to install it :)
